programme.title: Racetrack, Part 18
programme.desc: Ferrari Challenge Europe - Tropheo Pirelli & Coppa Shell

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: Martial arts specialist Ramazan creates a fight choreography that involves four stuntmen who play secret agents that try to nail him down. And somebody will spectacularly take off with a car.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: Fog, darkness and a pileup involving multiple cars, the Stunt Heroes want to recreate such a scene as part of a stunt with burning people, a fireman who arrives late at the scene and a car that flies through the air.

programme.title: Stunt Heroes
programme.desc: The Stunt Heroes leave their headquarters and travel to a ski resort. They simulate the attack of an army of soldiers all dressed in white. As part of this scene they want to make a car explode and fly through the air.

programme.title: Toyota GT86 J-Sport
programme.desc: With the Toyota GT 86 from J-Sport, it is noticeable that the company's roots lie in racing. The fans' wish to give the Japanese racer significantly more power nevertheless remained unfulfilled.

programme.title: Porsche Cayman GT4
programme.desc: The Porsche Cayman GT4. Lighter, more powerful and faster than ever. Porsche shows what is possible with this vehicle, when fast lap times are in the focus of attention.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: British limousines are the embodiment of luxury, they are the automotive upper class. Built with the most exclusive materials, these limousines like the Rolls Royce Phantom, Bentley Mulsanne or Jaguar XJ combine luxury, comfort and power.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: Whether it is the Mercedes S-Class, the BMW 7-series or the Audi A8, limousines "Made in Germany" are considered status symbols, setting standards when it comes to comfort, pioneering technologies and safety.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: International limousines by Rolls Royce, Bentley, Mercedes, BMW and Jaguar guarantee an exclusive appearance and stand for status, prestige and perfection. They are the benchmark when it comes to luxury and comfort.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: Power limousines like the BMW M5, Mercedes-AMG E63, Audi RS6 and Mulsanne Speed offer a unique mix of style, performance and suitability for daily use. They combine the luxury of a limousine with the dynamics of a super sports car.

programme.title: Dreamcars
programme.desc: They are masterpieces of automotive art, cars of breathtaking elegance, extraordinary performance, built for speeds beyond imagination: Bugatti Chiron, Lykan Hypersports, Pagani Huayra and Ferrari LaFerrari.

programme.title: BMW Kelleners Sport 640i Grand Coupe
programme.desc: The Kelleners Sport 640i is based on one of the most beautiful 4-door coupes. The tuning company of Ralf Kelleners, the son of a three-time European touring car champion, made a name for itself by specializing in remodeling BMWs.

programme.title: Volkswagen Touareg V6 TDI
programme.desc: Volkswagen subjected the Touareg to a radical makeover. After the end of the Phaeton, it's the new luxury top model from VW. Hopes are high: it has to sell big so that management can restore the peoples' confidence in the Volkswagen brand.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: The first Grand Cherokee manufactured under the reign of Fiat is up for our test. The fourth generation of this classic looks much more elegant than before. Also: Opel's first electric family limousine, the Ampera. And: the Ssangyong Korrando.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: The new BMW One M Coupe from former race car driver Ralf Kelleners: the KS1 RS. Also: Toyota present their TS 030 hybrid at the 24-hours race of Le Mans. And: Subaru's XV crossover stands out from the company's model range.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: The 'little' Mercedes-Benz S250 with a four-cylinder engine needs so little fuel that one could call this car a piggybank. Also: the power packages Nissan 370 Z and Wiesmann GT MF5. And: the ADAC Eco Test.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: The new Porsche Boxter, a real open-top sports car. Also: Volkswagen presents the new Passat Alltrack, a real allrounder. And: Fiat's successful Panda model in its third generation version.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: Alfa Romeo present their Giulietta 2.0 model with new engines, a new TCR transmission and a minor facelift. Also: Mazda aim for compact SUV gold with the CX-5. And: the Mercedes-Benz E 300 BlueTEC Hybrid.

programme.title: Facel Vega Facellia
programme.desc: In the late 1950s, the Facel Vega Facellia was designed to compete with Porsche and Alfa Romeo and open a new market segment for the fledgling French luxury car company.

programme.title: Maserati Quattroporte GTS
programme.desc: 1963, over 50 years ago, with the Quattroporte Maserati invented a new vehicle category, the sports sedan. This GTS model is already the 6th generation of this iconic car.

programme.title: Porsche Cayenne E-Hybrid
programme.desc: Porsche presented the latest version of its luxury SUV Cayenne in southern France. The E-Hybrid combines the best of two worlds: it's very agile but can also drive short distances purely electrically.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: Being one step ahead of time has always been a bit pricier. But is the new BMW i8 just an luxurious, avant-garde carrier of technology or can it already be considered as a serious sports car? Why should you pay double the price compared to the BMW M4? Why shouldn’t you buy a good looking BMW M5, which has the same price, but is more functional? Supercars reveals the answers.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: The Porsche 911 GTS is the latest model in the iconic 911 sports car range. With an output of 430 HP it closes the gap between the S model and the GT3. Supercars gets the chance to take a ride in the new Porsche 911 GTS in California. Plus: The Roding Roadster is a small series lightweight sports car from Bavaria and uses technology from BMW under its bonnet.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: These days there's hardly a car manufacturer who doesn¿t build any kind of SUV. Three of the sportiest SUVs on the market are the Porsche Macan Turbo, Mercedes GLA 45 AMG and Audi RSQ3. Each of them comes with more than 300 HP; they are well prepared for any season and have ambitions to be sports car. Supercars finds out, if they have what it takes to be a sports car.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: The Porsche Panamera Turbo S is the most dynamic sedan in the world. No other car finds the perfect balance between calm gliding on the one hand and extreme performance on the other hand. 570 hp, 3,8 seconds from zero to 100 km/h and a top speed of 310 km/h are impressive performance data for this big car. Plus: the Jaguar XJR with a 550 hp V8 engine and the Mercedes CLS 500.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: Luxury does not necesseraly mean to waste time. Hybrid is one of the techniques wich promises less fuel consumption with a still powerful engine. Lexus ist the pioneer in electrification of cars. Supercars drives the new LS 600h, The BMW Actiev Hybrid 7 and teh Porsche Panamera S E-Hybrid.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: The Silvretta Hochalpenstrasse in Austria is the ideal playground for the lightweight power packs Lotus Elise and Roding Roadster. These two roadsters are glued to the street and therefore a lot of fun to drive. And: the elegant but still very powerful Porsche 911 Targa 4S.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: If people hear the name Aston Martin they imagine James Bond adventures, British style, performance and luxury. The brand's Vantage N430 model is a sports car that makes drivers and enthusiasts feel the heritage of British race cars. Also: a combination of elegance and power, the Bentley Continental GTC Speed with its W12 Twin Turbo engine.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: In 2014, Mercedes-Benz presented their first Plug-in Hybrid, the S500. With a declared average consumption of 2.8 liters the S500 was the most fuel-efficient luxury car on the market. Also: when it comes to Bentley, a V8 engine basically means down-sizing. We took a look at the British brand's Flying Spur version with a smaller engine. And: the 6th generation Maserati Quattroporte.

programme.title: Volkswagen Touareg V6 TDI
programme.desc: Volkswagen subjected the Touareg to a radical makeover. After the end of the Phaeton, it's the new luxury top model from VW. Hopes are high: it has to sell big so that management can restore the peoples' confidence in the Volkswagen brand.

programme.title: Jeep Wrangler
programme.desc: In 2018 the fourth generation of the Wrangler was introduced. I contained state-of-the-art technology, but the rugged look remained the same. The brand works hard to maintain this silhouette since the very first Jeep ever, the Willys MB.

programme.title: Racetrack, Part 18
programme.desc: Ferrari Challenge Europe - Tropheo Pirelli & Coppa Shell

programme.title: Ignition GT
programme.desc: Ernest gets behind the wheel of the GWM P300. BYD’s Shark 6 prepares to take a bite out of the bakkie segment and Zee finds out how the Ford Ranger makes towing stress-free.

programme.title: Buyer's Guide
programme.desc: We find the perfect sporty vehicle for a 22-year-old. We go in search of a SUV suited for towing and we discuss the long-term ownership prospects of a VW Polo.

programme.title: Garage Gold
programme.desc: We’re in Johannesburg for the annual Angela’s Picnic. Mmasea meets up with the ultimate American muscle car aficionado. And we have two iconic BMWs going head to head in our Garage Gold Concourse Competition.

programme.title: Petrolheads
programme.desc: We meet a group of passionate BMW owners at Car Candy Inc. We find out more about the first wireless dyno in South Africa. A very special Renault Megane climbs its way up the Drag Kings leader board and we meet a band of legendary local racing heroes.

programme.title: Porsche Ruf RT35
programme.desc: Ruf RT35 may look like a Porsche, but it really isn't. Since 1981, the Ruf company in Pfaffhausen, Germany, has been recognized as an independent manufacturer. But the basis for its vehicles comes exclusively from Porsche. A Ruf is even faster and more exclusive than a comparable Porsche.

programme.title: Mustang
programme.desc: The Ford Mustang Shelby GT-500 was born of the 1960's vibe and the racing experience of Carroll Shelby. Its "boulevard cruiser" style and powerful engine made this muscle car one of the highest sellers of its time.

programme.title: Corvette
programme.desc: The 1963 Split-Window Stingray Coupe combined power, performance, precision and youthful design. Its unique, sleek and progressive look has kept it a perennial favorite with auto enthusiasts and collectors.

programme.title: Oldsmobile
programme.desc: The Oldsmobile F88 was a GM "dream car" with sleek, sophisticated styling, but it never reached production. After many decades, there is one to be seen, and how and why it is finally available to view is a story in itself!

programme.title: Pierce Arrow
programme.desc: 1913 38C Brougham - "built up to a standard, not down to a price" - was worth the value of several houses at the time, with the special cachet of being the first car owned by the White House.

programme.title: Duesenberg
programme.desc: The 1930 Model J Duesenberg was the pinnacle of automotive engineering in power and speed, holding records not surpassed until the 1960's. Magnates like Hearst, the King of Spain and the movie star Gary Cooper owned Duesenbergs.

programme.title: Terraplane
programme.desc: The Hudson Terraplane 1937 Series 72 was a fast and affordable car with unique style and innovative design. But the cars were also reliable and well built, so the company, unlike others, survived the Depression.

programme.title: Chevrolet Corvair
programme.desc: Despite a production number of nearly 1.4 million units the Chevrolet Corvair is virtually unknown in Europe. It was innovative, efficient, modern and cheap. Nevertheless, it was slandered, torn apart and later reviled.

programme.title: Jaguar E-Type
programme.desc: On 15 March 1961 an E-Type Coupe was presented to the press at the Geneva Motor Show. The response to the shrill Jaguar was mostly positive. In Geneva alone, 500 E-Types were ordered. However It was initially not clear whether the E-Type could be presented in Geneva at all, because the car was finished so late that test driver Norman Dewis had to race the exhibit from Coventry to Geneva in the shortest time.

programme.title: Bentley S2 Continental Flying Spur
programme.desc: Flowing lines and an elegance that is unmatched. The 1959 Bentley S2 Continental Flying Spur aims to build bridges in the company's model range. From the sporty origin of the brand to the luxury of its new owner, Rolls Royce.

programme.title: Citroen DS
programme.desc: La Déesse. The goddess of Citroën. This car caused an uproar when it was presented in 1955 at the Paris Motor Show. The DS was the first sedan with disc brakes and hydropneumatic suspension, and its design was simply divine.

programme.title: Ignition GT
programme.desc: Ernest gets behind the wheel of the GWM P300. BYD’s Shark 6 prepares to take a bite out of the bakkie segment and Zee finds out how the Ford Ranger makes towing stress-free.

programme.title: Buyer's Guide
programme.desc: We find the perfect sporty vehicle for a 22-year-old. We go in search of a SUV suited for towing and we discuss the long-term ownership prospects of a VW Polo.

programme.title: Garage Gold
programme.desc: We’re in Johannesburg for the annual Angela’s Picnic. Mmasea meets up with the ultimate American muscle car aficionado. And we have two iconic BMWs going head to head in our Garage Gold Concourse Competition.
